task_summary: The robot must reach the blue pen while avoiding the obstacle (books), sequentially perceiving, navigating and verifying the target.

task_long_description.overview: This scenario features a desktop environment where a robot arm is required to reach a blue pen located behind obstructing books. The robot must first perceive both the pen and obstacles, plan a collision-free route, move towards an intermediate safe waypoint, and then approach the pen. Throughout, robust perception and navigation ensure avoidance and precise localization, with verification at the end.
preconditions: Robot arm is operational and unoccupied
Workspace is clear except for detected books (obstacle) and pen (goal)
Pen and obstacle in camera's field of view
stepwise_plan: Check for visibility of the blue pen
Scan for pen if not seen (up to 3 times)
Move to a safe waypoint to bypass the obstacle
Move from waypoint to the blue pen
success_criteria: Robot is positioned at the blue pen location
Obstacle was not contacted or displaced
Pen remains in view and position unchanged
failure_and_recovery: Pen not detected: scan up to 3 times
Obstacle not detected: fallback to detection
Blocked by obstacle: choose safe waypoint (predefined)
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when robot is at blue pen, having bypassed obstacle without contact.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: avoid obstacle and reach the blue pen

node_specs.description: Checks if the blue pen is visible to the sensor.
Scans area using a grid pattern to find the blue pen up to 3 times.
Uses perception to detect the exact location of the blue pen.
Checks if the obstacle (books) is visible to the sensor.
Detects the location of the obstacle.
Moves the robot to a predefined waypoint that avoids the obstacle.
Moves the robot to the blue pen position.
Checks if the robot is at the location of the blue pen.

recovery_strategy: Scan for pen up to 3 times
assumptions: Frames reveal books as the main obstacle which is not specified by instruction; pen and obstacle positions inferred from visual evidence.
The robot utilizes an intermediate waypoint to avoid contact with books before proceeding to pen.
No grasp or manipulation of pen required; 'reach' means navigate/position near pen.

expected_success_criteria: Robot reaches vicinity of blue pen without contacting obstacle
